intro: Hypobathrum collinum, commonly known as the mountain beardtongue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Hypobathrum collinum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
